name: Party Crasher Artistry Palette
about: What it is:A tonal curation of six richly pigmented, icy lavender and plum shades...Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens and phthalates. These products are also cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know:This palette includes two Molten Metal Eyeshadows that can be applied wet or dry, plus four complementary matte shadows for melodramatic, multidimensional effects..This Palette Contains:

how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply dry for creamy effects. Using the side of a packing brush, sweep across lids for smooth, blendable, incredibly luminous payoff. .-Apply wet for liquid effects. Spray your brush tip with Continuous Setting Mist (sold separately) or water before picking up eyeshadow. Glide along lashlines or creases for molten shine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Obsessed with the shades, beautiful pay-off and great price!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have many large morphe palettes and am used to the varying quality. I don't usually mind because they're cheap and  I use them mainly for a soft base layer and blending out in conjunction with my high-end shadows... but this new product is the worst ever! Hard, dry and barely any pigment at all. No staying power. Comparable (or worse) to the old 'elf holiday palettes from the drug store. So much effort for very little payoff. You had me and you lost me Morphe. ðŸ«¤ Do better!
